entities.name: gringotts
entities.description: Gringotts is mentioned as a place that would be less dangerous to break into than to renege on a promise to a goblin. ("It would be less dangerous to break into Gringotts than to renege on a promise to a goblin.")

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who has made a promise to a goblin and is considering breaking into Gringotts. ("It would be less dangerous to break into Gringotts than to renege on a promise to a goblin.")

entities.name: bill
entities.description: Bill is mentioned as the one who opened the door for Harry. ("As he followed Bill back to the others...")

entities.name: teddy lupin
entities.description: Teddy Lupin is mentioned as the son of Harry and a godfather figure. ("He seemed set on course to become just as reckless a godfather to Teddy Lupin as Sirius Black had been to him.")

entities.name: sirius black
entities.description: Sirius Black is mentioned as an example of a reckless godfather. ("He seemed set on course to become just as reckless a godfather to Teddy Lupin as Sirius Black had been to him.")

relationships.description: Harry has made a promise to a goblin, and breaking into Gringotts is less dangerous than renege on that promise. ("It would be less dangerous to break into Gringotts than to renege on a promise to a goblin.")

Harry is set on course to become just as reckless a godfather to Teddy Lupin as Sirius Black had been to him. ("He seemed set on course to become just as reckless a godfather to Teddy Lupin as Sirius Black had been to him.")
